title: Rules & Etiquette
subtitle: The foundation of a fair and competitive community.
intro_text: This Code of Conduct applies to all members participating in duels, ladders, and discussions. Its purpose is to ensure a fair, respectful, and enjoyable environment for everyone. By dueling here, you agree to abide by these principles.

rules.title: Respect Your Opponent
rules.desc: Win or lose, treat your fellow players with respect. Trash talk, harassment, and toxic behavior are not acceptable.

rules.title: Play Fair
rules.desc: The goal is to test skill, not to exploit loopholes. Adhere to the spirit of the rules, not just the letter.

rules.title: Be Honorable
rules.desc: Do not intentionally mislead opponents about rules or formats. Communicate clearly and honestly.

rules.title: Know the Rules
rules.desc: It is your responsibility to know the specific ruleset for the duel you are participating in (e.g., Caster Ladder, ZvZ, Open 1v1).

rules.title: Honor the "Go" Call
rules.desc: Combat must not begin until both players have signaled they are ready according to the specific ruleset (e.g., typing "go" or "g").

rules.title: No Mid-Duel Changes
rules.desc: Do not respec (use a Token) or make unapproved changes to your character during a match.

rules.title: Handle Draws Fairly
rules.desc: Follow the specific draw-handling rules for the matchup. If a round needs to be replayed, do so without argument.

rules.title: No Cheating
rules.desc: The use of hacks, maphacks, bots, or any third-party program that provides an unfair advantage is strictly forbidden and will result in immediate and permanent removal.

rules.title: Gear Checks
rules.desc: If a gear check is requested (where permitted), comply promptly and honestly.

rules.title: Accusations
rules.desc: If you suspect a rule has been broken, remain calm. Complete the match if possible, save any evidence (screenshots, video), and contact an admin privately. Do not make public accusations in general chat.

rules.title: Clarity is Key
rules.desc: Be clear when arranging matches, choosing formats, and starting rounds.

rules.title: Dispute Resolution
rules.desc: If a disagreement occurs, try to resolve it respectfully with your opponent first. If a resolution cannot be found, contact an admin or moderator for a final ruling. The admin's decision is final.

ladder_rules_intro: This document outlines the general rules and philosophy that govern all official ladders. While this serves as our foundational ruleset, many ladders have unique rules tailored to their specific matchups.
ladder_rules_responsibility: It is every player's responsibility to read and understand the specific rules for the ladder they are participating in.

rules.title: Default Location
rules.desc: Hell Difficulty, Act 1, Blood Moor. (Note: Melee ladders use Normal Difficulty, Inner Cloister).

rules.title: Victory Condition
rules.desc: Typically First-to-10 (FT10).

rules.title: Duel Start
rules.desc: Combat does not begin until both players have signaled they are ready (e.g., typing "g" or "go"). For many melee duels, holding Shift and attacking signals the start.

rules.title: Positioning
rules.desc: Angling or "shift-locking" is not permitted in melee matchups.

rules.title: Potions
rules.desc: Healing and Rejuvenation potions are universally banned. Mana potions are typically allowed in caster/hybrid matchups.

rules.title: Town Visits
rules.desc: Returning to town for any reason during a round is a forfeiture of that round.

rules.title: Pre-buffing
rules.desc: Generally, only non-aggressive, timed buffs or specific summons are allowed to be cast in town before a round begins.

equipment_philosophy.title: 2. Common Equipment & Skill Philosophy
equipment_philosophy.intro: To promote skill-based duels, the following items and skills are frequently restricted.

rules.title: Life Tap
rules.desc: The Life Tap curse from any source is almost always banned. *Melee ladders - if agreed upon, TapFormat is allowed.

rules.title: Absorb
rules.desc: Stacking absorb is forbidden. A limit of one item per element is standard.

rules.title: Slow Effects
rules.desc: Items that apply "Slows Target by %" are typically banned.

rules.title: Banned Skills
rules.desc: Certain skills are often restricted to ensure balance (e.g., Iron Maiden vs. Melee).

final_reminder_text: The rules listed above are a general guideline. Specific ladders will have different rules regarding allowed skills, banned items, locations, and procedures. Always check the ruleset for the specific ladder you are playing in before you begin your match. Failure to do so is not an excuse for breaking a rule.
